content.description: The <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mtext>th</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> term test can be used to determine divergence for which of the following series?
content.question: <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to infinity, of, the natural log of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator k plus 1, and denominator k, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the sum, from k equals 0, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, to the k power, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator k, and denominator 2 k, plus 1, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 3 times k squared, minus k cubed, and denominator 5 times k cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 10.3: (BC ONLY) The Nth Term Test for Divergence

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
